column99:
We are looking for an End User Computing Engineer for our client in the Banking Industry. Your role will be to manage, maintain, and improve their organization’s IT end-user computing infrastructure. The role involves package creation, deploying, supporting, and optimizing tools like CAPA Installer, Intune, SCCM, Microsoft 365 (M365), Exchange, and Distribution List Management (DLB). 
   
 Location: Greater Copenhagen, hybrid. 
 


QUALIFICATIONS & COMPETENCIES
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience) 
 Proven experience with tools like CAPA Installer, Intune, SCCM, etc. and M365 administration 
 Packaging, deployment, sccm, capa installer, intune, documentation 
 Solid understanding of Active Directory, Group Policy, and Azure AD 
 Experience with endpoint security and compliance management 
 Scripting skills (PowerShell, VBScript, etc.) for automation 
 Familiarity with ITIL practices for incident, problem, and change management 
 Strong technical expertise and a proactive approach to providing excellent user experiences 
 Experience from the Banking industry 
 Relevant educational background 
 Valid EU work permit making you able to start right away 
 Professional level of English - both oral and written 
 


AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY
 
 Design, implement, and maintain end-user computing solutions using tools like Intune, SCCM, and CAPA Installer 
 Packaging, software deployment (sccm, capa installer, intune), documentation, powershell, vbs 
 Automate application packaging and deployment processes 
 Manage and secure endpoints (Windows, Mac, mobile devices) using Microsoft Intune and other tools 
 Plan, schedule, and deploy patches and software updates using SCCM and Intune 
 Ensure compliance with security standards 
 Develop and maintain technical documentation, including SOPs and knowledge base articles 
 Identify areas for automation and optimization in EUC processes 
 Work closely with IT teams to align end-user computing services with organizational goals 
 Provide training and support to team members to enhance productivity 
 Implement and maintain device compliance policies 
 


INTERESTED?
 Please note that to apply for this position, you must go to our website. We are unable to process CVs sent directly to our email. 
 
 If you have questions about the position, please contact us on: 
    denmark@rdtengineers.com 
 The position will be closed when we have found the right candidate, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Notice only your CV in English is necessary.
Passionate about Engineering - RDT
 At RDT, our primary focus is our PEOPLE. We support our employees in professional and individual development. With our flat hierarchy, commitment and values, which inspire them to do their best. We pursue our PEOPLE’s work satisfaction and can guarantee highest quality, which leads to our second mission – our CLIENTS. We, our PEOPLE, provide engineering solutions that enable our customers to have a competitive advantage in efficiency, flexibility and costs. 
 Thanks to our PEOPLE, we have supplied the best engineering services since 2007 and offer the best and most flexible terms in the market for engineering services. 
 Be part of our missions and join RDT in Denmark.
